headline: Erie Indemnity Plans CEO Transition As Market Weighs Earnings Miss
summary: Erie Indemnity (NasdaqGS:ERIE) announced that CEO Tim NeCastro plans to retire at the end of 2026. The board has started a formal leadership succession process to identify and prepare the next chief executive. NeCastro has served as CEO for roughly a decade, a period that included the company’s 100th anniversary and expansion into new markets. For you as an investor, this is a leadership change at the top of a long established insurance services company that supports the Erie Insurance...
